      • mergeMaps

        public static <K,V> void mergeMaps(Map<K,int[]> map0,
                                   Map<K,int[]> map1Orig)
        Merges two maps of int arrays keyed by Objects. If the two maps have the same key, their respective values are combined into a single, sorted array with all duplicates eliminated. The keys are sorted as well before being returned to the first original map. Modifies the first map!
        Type Parameters:
        K - generic representing the class of the keys
        V - generic representing the class of the values
        Parameters:
        map0 - the first map (becomes modified)
        map1Orig - the second map

      • toValidJS

        public static String toValidJS(String str)
        Converts a Java String to a Javascript-compatible String. E.g.,
        var str = '<%= Utils.toValidJS(str) %>';

        IMPORTANT: assumes that the Javascript String is inside single quotes.

        Parameters:
        str - a string
        Returns:
        Javascript-compatible string

      • toValidTextbox

        public static String toValidTextbox(String str)
        Convert a string so that the raw data can be displayed and edited in input textboxes and textareas. Character entity references representing foreign language characters will not be converted and will display as the foreign language characters.
        Parameters:
        str - a string
        Returns:
        textbox-compatible string

      • toValidTextbox

        public static String toValidTextbox(String str,
                                    int convertAmps)
        Convert a string so that the raw data can be displayed and edited in input textboxes and textareas.
        Parameters:
        str - a string
        convertAmps - whether to convert ampersands; if EXCEPT_CER_NUMS (usual case), ampersands followed by # will not be converted to &amp; and, as a result, character entity references will be displayed as the characters.
        Returns:
        converted string

      • toValidHTMLAttributeValue

        public static String toValidHTMLAttributeValue(String str)
        Converts a Java String to a String that can be assigned to a value of an option or hidden input HTML attribute. E.g.,
        <input type="hidden" value="<%= Utils.toValidHTMLAttributeValue(str) %>" />
        Parameters:
        str - a string
        Returns:
        attribute-compatible string

      • tryAppend

        private static boolean tryAppend(StringBuilder out,
                                 char theChar)
        Utility method for toValidTextbox(), toValidHTMLAttributeValue(), and XMLUtils.toValidXML(). Throws \n, \r, \, and & back to calling methods because they treat them differently; appends character entity references for ', ", <, and > to a growing Stringbuilder; appends other characters unchanged.
        Parameters:
        out - a StringBuilder
        theChar - the character to be inspected
        Returns:
        true if we have already appended a character to the StringBuilder

        str - a string
        Returns:
        string formatted for HTML

        Returns:

      • toValidURI

        public static String toValidURI(String str)

        Parameters:
        str - a string
        Returns:
        string that can be used as a URI

      • toValidHref

        public static String toValidHref(String str)

        Parameters:
        str - a string
        Returns:
        string that can be used as an href

      • toValidHrefOrURI

                                       boolean forURI)

        str - a string
        forURI - whether this string will be used as part of a URI
